introduction: In this lecture, we will discuss the basics of programming languages, focusing on C and how it translates to machine language. We will explore the tool chain and the various stages involved in the conversion process. We will also touch on assembly language and its role in the process.

sections.title: Section 1: Introduction to Programming Languages
content: Explanation of programming languages and their purpose.
Discussion on high-level and low-level languages.
Overview of C as a compiled language.
Introduction to the tool chain and its components.

sections.title: Section 2: The Preprocessor
content: Explanation of the preprocessor and its role in the tool chain.
Discussion on how the preprocessor converts C code to assembly language.
Example of a simple C program and its assembly language representation.
Comparison of static and dynamic linking.

sections.title: Section 3: The Assembler
content: Explanation of the assembler and its role in the tool chain.
Discussion on how the assembler translates assembly language to machine language.
Example of an assembly program and its machine language representation.
Introduction to dynamic linking.

sections.title: Section 4: The Linker
content: Explanation of the linker and its role in the tool chain.
Discussion on how the linker resolves external references and creates an executable file.
Example of a simple program with external libraries and their resolution.
Comparison of static and dynamic linking.

sections.title: Section 5: Assembly Language and Machine Language
content: Explanation of assembly language and its relationship to machine language.
Discussion on the differences between assembly and machine language.
Example of an assembly program and its machine language representation.
Comparison of assembly and machine language execution speed.
topics: Assembly vs Machine Language Execution Speed
Assembly vs Machine Language Execution Speed
